structure.unit: GENERAL PROVISIONS AS TO OFFICES AND OFFICERS -- SOCIAL SECURITY FOR PUBLIC EMPLOYEES -- EMPLOYEES RETIREMENT SYSTEM

law.catch_line: Chief state school officer to deliver effects to successor -- Penalty.
law.text: Upon retiring from office the chief state school officer shall deliver to his successor all books, papers, and effects belonging to the office, and on failure to do so he shall be fined not less than one hundred dollars ($100) nor more than five hundred dollars ($500), which shall be recovered by indictment in the Franklin Circuit Court.
law.history: Amended 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 476, Pt. IV, sec. 119, effective July 13, 1990. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4384-33.
